com.exercise.maven.project_final_assignment_OOP.MainClass

Class CalculatorWindow

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.exercise.maven.project_final_assignment_OOP.MainClass.CalculatorWindow

  • public class CalculatorWindow
extends java.lang.Object
    CalculatorWindow
    Version:
    1.0 This class was intended to be separated into one GUI class and one class for methods and functions to the calculator. This will be fixed in a later version, promise!
    Author:
    Brita Jonsson

    • Method Detail

      • initialize

        public void initialize()
        Initialize the contents of the frame.

      • addComponents

        public void addComponents()
        Adding the components to the frame and setting their properties.

      • activateAdvanceButtons

        public void activateAdvanceButtons()
        Activates the Advances buttons

      • deActivateAdvanceButtons

        public void deActivateAdvanceButtons()
        Deactivates the Advances buttons

      • switchMode

        public void switchMode()
        The switch between Basic and Advanced mode.

      • startAddition

        public void startAddition()
        First action of the addition calculation, invoked by pressing btnAddition. Saves the number in the display as firstNumber and set the corresponding operator sign as chosenOperator.

      • continueAddition

        public void continueAddition()
        Last action of the addition calculation, invoked when running doCalculation(). Saves the number in the display as secondNumber and perform the calculation. The result is written in the display. If btnEquals is pressed repetitively, secondNumber will be added to the result from the first calculation one more time.

      • startSubtraction

        public void startSubtraction()
        First action of the subtraction calculation, invoked by pressing btnSubtraction. Saves the number in the display as firstNumber and set the corresponding operator sign as chosenOperator.

      • continueSubtraction

        public void continueSubtraction()
        Last action of the subtraction calculation, invoked when running doCalculation(). Saves the number in the display as secondNumber and perform the calculation. The result is written in the display. If btnEquals is pressed repetitively, secondNumber will be deducted from the result from the first calculation one more time.

      • startMultiplication

        public void startMultiplication()
        First action of the multiplication calculation, invoked by pressing btnMultiplication. Saves the number in the display as firstNumber and set the corresponding operator sign as chosenOperator.

      • continueMultiplication

        public void continueMultiplication()
        Last action of the multiplication calculation, invoked when running doCalculation(). Saves the number in the display as secondNumber and perform the calculation. The result is written in the display. If btnEquals is pressed repetitively, secondNumber will be multiplied with the result from the first calculation one more time.

      • startDivision

        public void startDivision()
        First action of the division calculation, invoked by pressing btnDivision. Saves the number in the display as firstNumber and set the corresponding operator sign as chosenOperator.

      • continueDivision

        public void continueDivision()
        Last action of the division calculation, invoked when running doCalculation(). Saves the number in the display as secondNumber and perform the calculation. The result is written in the display. If btnEquals is pressed repetitively, the result from the first calculation will be divided with secondNumber one more time.

      • startPowerOf

        public void startPowerOf()
        First action of the power of calculation, invoked by pressing btnPowerOf. Saves the number in the display as firstNumber and set the corresponding operator sign as chosenOperator.

      • continuePowerOf

        public void continuePowerOf()
        Last action of the power of calculation, invoked when running doCalculation(). Saves the number in the display as secondNumber and perform the calculation. The result is written in the display. If btnEquals is pressed repetitively, the result from the first calculation will be raised to secondNumber.

      • performPowerOfTen

        public void performPowerOfTen()
        Performs the power of ten calculation, invoked when pressing btnPowerOfTen. Uses the number in the display as exponent and performs the calculation. The result is written in the display.

      • performSquareOf

        public void performSquareOf()
        Performs the square of calculation, invoked when pressing btnSquareOf. Uses the number in the display as base and performs the calculation. The result is written in the display.

      • performCubeOf

        public void performCubeOf()
        Performs the cube of calculation, invoked when pressing btnCubeOf. Uses the number in the display as base and performs the calculation. The result is written in the display.

      • startRemainder

        public void startRemainder()
        First action of the remainder calculation, invoked by pressing btnRemainder. Saves the number in the display as firstNumber and set the corresponding operator sign as chosenOperator.

      • continueRemainder

        public void continueRemainder()
        Last action of the remainder calculation, invoked when running doCalculation(). Saves the number in the display as secondNumber and perform the calculation. The result is written in the display. The remainder function of AdvancedCalculator class uses integers, this function will first find out if the two numbers have decimals or not. If they do, a message is shown on the display. If they don't, the numbers are converted to Integer and the calculation is done. The result is written in the display.

      • createRandomValue

        public void createRandomValue()
        Setting a random value between 0 and 1 on to the display.

      • getCleanState

        public void getCleanState()
        Resets the calculator so no data from old calculations is saved.

      • getDisplayValue

        public double getDisplayValue()
        The value in the display is saved as String. This method converts the string to a double with "," as decimal separator. If the value is not a number, the calculator is reset by getCleanState().
        Returns:
        The value in the display, as double

      • setDisplayValue

        public void setDisplayValue(double toBeDisplayed)
        The value in the display is saved as String. This method converts a double to String in order to show it in the display.
        Parameters:
        toBeDisplayed - The number to be displayed

      • checkIfFirstAction

        public boolean checkIfFirstAction()
        Checks if this is the first action, i.e. if a pressed button should result in starting a new number in screen or adding it to the existing number.
        Returns:
        True if it should start writing a new number, false if it should add to existing.

      • pinpadNumberPressed

        public void pinpadNumberPressed(java.lang.String pressedNumber)
        Prints the pressed number to the display, invoked when a number is pressed on the pinpad. If the display already contains 20 numbers, no number will be added.
        Parameters:
        pressedNumber - The number of the pressed button

      • addComma

        public void addComma()
        Adds a comma to the number in the display, invoked by pressing btnComma. If the display already contains 19 numbers or already contains a comma, nothing will be added.

      • doCalculation

        public void doCalculation()
        Invoked by pressing btnEquals. Checks which operator was chosen and run corresponding continue-method. Non-mentioned operators are handled directly in their ActionListener

      • addActionListeners

        public void addActionListeners()
        ActionListeners for all buttons.
